title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement maintainer@example.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html.

title: Contributing to macabre
text: Thank interest contributing. project welcomes site contributors collaborators. repository includes: - R package (code, tests, vignettes) - separate MkDocs website top-level docs/ directory Please edit docs/ mkdocs.yml working R package.

title: Contributing to macabre
text: site contributor, need touch site standardizer registry lists available sites. Start creating new site standardizer file: : 1. Edit R/sites/site_NEWSITE.R read raw data build canonical tables (obs systems). 2. Register site ml_registry(). 3. Run quick diagnostic check: Run tests open pull request.
code: ml_new_site_file("NEWSITE") ml_quickcheck_site("NEWSITE", inputs = list(path = "path/to/raw"))

title: Contributing to macabre
text: Core changes include harmonizer, schema, covariate tools. files changed maintainers request issue. sure, please open issue first.

title: Contributing to macabre
text: Validation errors expected building site standardizer. error messages meant read literally. Fix issue site standardizer rather trying bypass validation. stuck, open issue include error message short summary data.

title: Governance
text: Maintainers steward roadmap, review changes, publish releases. Reviewers provide subject-matter code review pull requests. Contributors submit issues pull requests.

title: Governance
text: use lazy-consensus model: changes approved objections within reasonable review window. Significant changes discussed issues first.

title: Governance
text: New maintainers nominated existing maintainers added consensus among current maintainers.

title: Governance
text: Update NEWS.md release notes. Run R CMD check ---cran. Tag release publish GitHub.

title: Governance
text: Maintainers may tighten CI rules documentation requirements time project matures. changes enforcement documented communicated release notes governance updates.

text: believe found security vulnerability, please report privately emailing maintainer@example.com. acknowledge report within 72 hours work resolution.

title: Security policy

title: Adding a site to the harmonization workflow
text: vignette explains add site standardizer run harmonization. focuses canonical tables (obs systems) steps site contributor follow.

title: Adding a site to the harmonization workflow
text: Raw data site site identifier (uppercase letters, numbers, underscores) template file R/sites/site_TEMPLATE.R

title: Adding a site to the harmonization workflow
text: Copy template rename : Edit standardize_NEWSITE() read raw data build obs systems. Register site ml_registry(). Run harmonization site:
code: R/sites/site_TEMPLATE.R -> R/sites/site_NEWSITE.R harmonize_material_legacies(   sites = "NEWSITE",   inputs = list(NEWSITE = list(path = "path/to/raw")) )

title: Adding a site to the harmonization workflow
text: Missing columns: canonical tables must include every required column. Wrong factor levels: use ml_vocab() see allowed values. Date/year mismatch: date must Date year must integer. System ID mismatch: every obs$system_id must exist systems$system_id.

title: Adding a site to the harmonization workflow
text: package includes small HFR fixture demonstration. use local data instead, point raw-data folder:
code: harmonize_material_legacies(   sites = "HFR",   inputs = list(HFR = list(use_fixture = TRUE)) ) harmonize_material_legacies(   sites = "HFR",   inputs = list(HFR = list(path = "path/to/hfr/raw")) )

title: Climate covariates (gridMET-style)
text: vignette shows add climate covariates harmonization. covariate step separate site standardizers.

title: Climate covariates (gridMET-style)
text: harmonized object (harmonize_material_legacies()) locations file site_id, plot_id, point polygon geometry Local climate raster files (NetCDF GeoTIFF) dates filenames

title: Climate covariates (gridMET-style)
text: code shown reference. Run locally installing optional spatial packages.
code: h <- harmonize_material_legacies(sites = "HFR", inputs = list(HFR = list(use_fixture = TRUE))) loc <- sf::st_read(system.file("extdata/locations/plots_points.geojson", package = "macabre"))  files <- list.files(   "path/to/local/covariates",   pattern = "gridmet_tmmx_.*\\.tif$",   full.names = TRUE )  cube <- ml_cube_from_local_netcdf(files, var_names = "tmmx")  spec <- ml_cov_gridmet_spec(vars = c("tmmx"))  h2 <- ml_add_covariates(   h,   covariates = list(list(spec = spec, cube = cube)),   locations = loc,   join = "plot_date" )

title: Climate covariates (gridMET-style)
text: Missing site_id plot_id columns locations file. Dates covariate files overlap observation dates. Using site-level locations choosing plot_date joins.

title: Site authoring worked example
text: vignette walks creating new site standardizer simple example. Use reference start site file.

title: Site authoring worked example
text: site template site identifier NEWSITE small set raw data can map canonical tables

title: Site authoring worked example
code: ml_new_site_file("NEWSITE")

what: 2) Translate raw data into the canonical tables
title: Site authoring worked example
text: Example (simplified):
code: obs <- tibble::tibble(   site_id = "NEWSITE",   system_id = "NEWSITE__deadwood__growth__01",   plot_id = "plot-1",   date = as.Date("2020-06-01"),   year = 2020L,   design = factor("observational", levels = ml_vocab()$design),   legacy_type = factor("deadwood", levels = ml_vocab()$legacy_type),   legacy_metric = "volume",   legacy_value = 1.5,   legacy_unit = "m3",   response_type = factor("growth", levels = ml_vocab()$response_type),   response_metric = "biomass",   response_value = 2.1,   response_unit = "g" )

title: Site authoring worked example
code: ml_registry <- function() {   list(     EXAMPLE = standardize_EXAMPLE,     HFR = standardize_HFR,     NEWSITE = standardize_NEWSITE   ) }

title: Site authoring worked example
code: ml_quickcheck_site("NEWSITE", inputs = list(path = "path/to/raw"))

title: Site authoring worked example
text: Missing columns obs systems. Factor values allowed vocabularies. system_id values match obs systems.

title: Material Legacy Effects Analysis Tools
text: macabre R package analysis repository LTER SPARC synthesis project ecological legacies dead foundation species across marine terrestrial ecosystems.

title: Material Legacy Effects Analysis Tools
text: project formerly distributed package name lterSparcMaterialLegacy. package renamed macabre provide short, memorable name collaborators. old package installed locally, remove reinstall macabre.

title: Material Legacy Effects Analysis Tools
text: Pull requests run lightweight R CMD check (Ubuntu + R release). Full matrix checks can run manually GitHub Actions tab run weekly schedule.

title: Material Legacy Effects Analysis Tools
text: macabre provides shared utilities workflows analyzing material legacy effects LTER SPARC projects. designed make collaboration datasets, analyses, reporting consistent across community.

title: Material Legacy Effects Analysis Tools
text: Package name: macabre. Current purpose: infrastructure plus early utilities support data harmonization, documentation, reproducible analysis. Expected growth: functions datasets expand project moves exploratory work cross-site synthesis publication-ready outputs. broader project overview public-facing updates, visit project website.

what: How to use this package (for now)

text: Load package library(macabre). Expect small, evolving set helper functions focused infrastructure; interfaces may change scientific workflow matures.

title: Material Legacy Effects Analysis Tools
text: Exploratory notebooks narrative analyses live project-notes/. document decisions, prototypes, analytical context, stable functions promoted R package can reused across sites workflows.

title: Material Legacy Effects Analysis Tools
text: pkgdown site rebuilt automatically merges default branch. gh-pages branch generated output; edit hand. site breaks, check GitHub Actions logs pkgdown workflow. GitHub Pages configured serve gh-pages branch (root).

title: Material Legacy Effects Analysis Tools
text: Run tests devtools::test(). Run full check devtools::check() R CMD check ---cran. Update documentation devtools::document(). Add NEWS entries user-facing changes. See CONTRIBUTING.md full contributor guide.

what: Harmonize material legacy data across sites — harmonize_material_legacies
title: Harmonize material legacy data across sites — harmonize_material_legacies
text: Runs one site standardizers, checks match canonical `obs` `systems` tables, combines results single object. site standardizer reads one site’s raw data returns two tables.

title: Harmonize material legacy data across sites — harmonize_material_legacies
code: harmonize_material_legacies(   sites = NULL,   registry = ml_registry(),   inputs = NULL,   strict = TRUE,   continue_on_error = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   return_site_outputs = FALSE )

title: Harmonize material legacy data across sites — harmonize_material_legacies
text: sites Character vector site identifiers run. Defaults sites. registry Named list site standardizers keyed site identifier. inputs Named list arguments passed site standardizer. strict Logical indicating whether enforce strict validation. continue_on_error Logical indicating whether continue site errors. quiet Logical indicating whether suppress progress messages. return_site_outputs Logical indicating whether include per-site outputs.

title: Harmonize material legacy data across sites — harmonize_material_legacies
text: object class ml_harmonized containing obs, systems, site_log, errors, timestamp.

title: Harmonize material legacy data across sites — harmonize_material_legacies
code: harmonize_material_legacies(sites = "EXAMPLE", quiet = TRUE) #> ml_harmonized object #>   Sites: 1 #>   Observations: 1 #>   Systems: 1  harmonize_material_legacies(   sites = "EXAMPLE",   inputs = list(EXAMPLE = list(path = "data/raw/EXAMPLE")),   quiet = TRUE ) #> ml_harmonized object #>   Sites: 1 #>   Observations: 1 #>   Systems: 1

what: Join climate covariates onto harmonized data — ml_add_covariates
title: Join climate covariates onto harmonized data — ml_add_covariates
text: Adds climate covariates harmonized observation table using join mode plot-date site-year. step modify site standardizers.

title: Join climate covariates onto harmonized data — ml_add_covariates
code: ml_add_covariates(   h,   covariates,   locations,   join = c("plot_date", "site_date", "plot_year", "site_year"),   keep = "all",   warn_join_loss = TRUE )

title: Join climate covariates onto harmonized data — ml_add_covariates
text: h ml_harmonized object. covariates covariate spec list specs. locations sf object site_id, plot_id, geometry. join Join mode covariates. keep Whether keep rows matched rows. warn_join_loss Warn join introduces missing values.

title: Join climate covariates onto harmonized data — ml_add_covariates
text: updated ml_harmonized object covariates join logs.

what: Create a gridMET covariate specification — ml_cov_gridmet_spec
title: Create a gridMET covariate specification — ml_cov_gridmet_spec
text: Creates specification gridMET-style covariates. settings object run extraction .

title: Create a gridMET covariate specification — ml_cov_gridmet_spec
code: ml_cov_gridmet_spec(   vars = c("tmmx", "tmmn", "pr"),   dt = "P1D",   agg_time = NULL,   agg_space = "mean",   res = c(0.04, 0.04) )

title: Create a gridMET covariate specification — ml_cov_gridmet_spec
text: vars Character vector gridMET variables. dt Temporal resolution (ISO8601 duration string). agg_time Optional temporal aggregation function. agg_space Spatial aggregation function polygons. res Spatial resolution degrees.

title: Create a gridMET covariate specification — ml_cov_gridmet_spec
text: object class ml_cov_spec.

what: Create a gdalcubes cube from local files — ml_cube_from_local_netcdf
title: Create a gdalcubes cube from local files — ml_cube_from_local_netcdf

title: Create a gdalcubes cube from local files — ml_cube_from_local_netcdf
code: ml_cube_from_local_netcdf(   files,   var_names = NULL,   view = NULL,   dt = "P1D",   res = c(0.04, 0.04),   srs = "EPSG:4326" )

title: Create a gdalcubes cube from local files — ml_cube_from_local_netcdf
text: files Character vector local NetCDF GeoTIFF files. var_names Optional variable names, length 1 length files. view Optional gdalcubes cube view. dt Temporal resolution (ISO8601 duration string). res Spatial resolution degrees. srs Spatial reference system string.

title: Create a gdalcubes cube from local files — ml_cube_from_local_netcdf
